properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 2 at 2:25AM CST until March 2 at 8:30AM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Douglas County in southwestern Missouri...
Northern Howell County in south central Missouri...

* Until 830 AM CST Monday.

* At 224 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing
heavy rain across the warned area. Up to two inches of rain have
already fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin
shortly. Another one to two inches of rain is expected.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other
drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
West Plains...                    Ava...
Mountain View...                  Willow Springs...
Pomona...                         Peace Valley...
Brushyknob...                     Gentryville...
Siloam Springs...                 White Church...
Rome...                           Vanzant...
Squires...                        Goodhope...
Drury...                          Dogwood...

This warning includes but is not limited to the following low water
crossings...
Route FF at Hunter Creek east of Ava...
Route FF at Turkey Creek east of Ava...
Route Y at Cowskin Creek 3 miles west of Ava...
Route Y, 4 miles northwest of Mountain View...
and Route U, 6 miles east of Willow Springs.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.
